name: Royal Academy of Art, The Hague (KABK)
description:
The Royal Academy of Art in The Hague holds the distinction of being the oldest academy in the country, with its roots dating back to the 16th century. Historical records mention the presence of a Lucas guild in The Hague during that time. In 1656, a significant development occurred when a separation within the guild gave rise to the Pictura brotherhood. This division aimed to distinguish genuine artists from lesser painters.

By 1682, the Pictura Brotherhood took a monumental step by establishing an academy, which serves as the precursor to our present-day institution, the Royal Academy of Art (KABK) in The Hague. Initially, this academy primarily focused on providing brotherhood members with opportunities to enhance their drawing skills.

Today, the KABK continues its tradition of nurturing talent and preparing students to become self-aware artists and designers. Our mission is to empower individuals who, with their passion, depth of understanding, and experimental approach, make significant contributions to their respective disciplines and society at large.

Upon entering our institution, you can immediately sense the vibrant atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and professionalism that permeates the environment. Many students choose to study at the KABK precisely because of this unique ambiance. Opting for the KABK means choosing a future in the realm of art and culture, with access to contemporary and comprehensive programs tailored to help you cultivate and showcase your individual creative potential.

name: Royal Institute of Art in Stockholm
description:
The Royal Institute of Art, located in Stockholm, is a distinguished institution of higher education with a rich artistic heritage dating back to 1735. Today, it operates as a state-owned organization under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education. Our institution places art at the forefront, emphasizing both artistic freedom and the pursuit of knowledge.

At the Royal Institute of Art, we offer a unique blend of artistic diversity and excellence, providing programs in Fine Arts at both the foundational and advanced levels. Our advanced-level standalone courses cater to professional artists, architects, and individuals within the cultural and humanities sectors. Additionally, we are a hub for research activities. As a cultural institution, we extend our offerings to the public, hosting exhibitions, seminars, and workshops that are open to all. Our mission is to facilitate the convergence of art and education.

We foster an environment of experimentation and artistic exploration, embracing calculated risks in the pursuit of growth. Our faculty comprises practicing artists who impart their expertise in various domains, including print-making, painting, sculpture, video, sound, photography, interactive techniques, performance, and critical studies. Our campus, situated on Skeppsholmen in central Stockholm, seamlessly combines historically significant buildings with modern workshops, creating a dynamic space for students, researchers, and staff. This setting allows us to preserve artistic traditions while continuously developing new techniques and methods. The art produced here is both a reflection of the past and an exploration of new horizons, mirroring our institution's dual nature of tradition and renewal.

Our students' artistic work takes center stage in our educational approach. Through collaborative, reflective processes, various forms of artistic expressions intersect and enrich one another. Within our community of 230 students, a wide spectrum of aesthetics, perspectives, and approaches coexist harmoniously. Our education and research realms form an ever-evolving pool of knowledge, driven by a shared desire for experimentation and critical discourse. By introducing novel approaches and subjecting different modes of artistic expression to mutual scrutiny, our faculty, researchers, and students create an environment conducive to lifelong learning.

We embrace interdisciplinary work, fostering exchanges and partnerships with related fields in culture, science, and the broader community. Our collaborative endeavors extend to organizing exhibitions, screenings, performances, and a variety of open lectures, seminars, and workshops. Distinguished guest lecturers, hailing from local and international higher education institutions, as well as individual artistic practitioners from across the globe, contribute to the richness of our intellectual and creative pursuits.

name: Shanghai Jiao Tong University
description: Established in 1896, Shanghai Jiao Tong University stands as one of China's most esteemed academic institutions. While Mandarin remains the primary medium of instruction, there is a growing trend towards offering undergraduate and postgraduate courses in English or through collaborative programs with international universities. The university boasts multiple campuses throughout Shanghai, each sprawling with an extensive array of amenities. These include numerous badminton, tennis, and basketball courts, along with bookstores, canteens, cafes, and restaurants, creating a vibrant and dynamic environment for its students and faculty.
other_campuses: Antai Building, 535 Fahua Zhen Rd., Shanghai, CN,China (Mainland)
similar_universities: The Central Academy of Drama, China
Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech)
The University of New South Wales (UNSW Sydney)

name: Umea University
description:
Umeå University is among the largest higher education institutions in Sweden, boasting a student body of over 34,000 individuals and a dedicated faculty and staff comprising 4,000 professionals. Our university is renowned for its world-leading research across various scientific disciplines, and we offer a wide range of educational programs that consistently receive high rankings on the global stage. Notably, Umeå University is the birthplace of the groundbreaking CRISPR-Cas9 genetic editing technology, a revolutionary advancement in genetic engineering that was honored with the Nobel Prize in Chemistry.

One of the distinctive features of Umeå University is the close-knit campus environment. Here, everything you need is within easy reach. This cohesive setting fosters opportunities for students and faculty to come together, collaborate, and share knowledge seamlessly. As a result, we nurture a vibrant and open culture that celebrates each other's achievements and successes.

name: Universidad de Buenos Aires (UBA)
description: The Universidad de Buenos Aires (UBA), established in 1821, stands as one of the most significant universities in Latin America. With its substantial size and extensive history, UBA has made notable contributions, including producing four Nobel Prize laureates, numerous presidents, and iconic figures like the Marxist guerrilla fighter Che Guevara. UBA enjoys immense respect and recognition throughout the region for its academic excellence and historical significance.
similar_universities: J. Mack Robinson College of Business

name: Yonsei University
description:
Established in 1885, Yonsei University holds the distinction of being the first Western institution of learning in Korea, and it stands as a leading educational institution situated in the heart of Seoul. The university's core mission is to educate and nurture leaders who are dedicated to contributing to humanity in the spirit of "truth and freedom." Yonsei University is committed to fostering education, research, medical care, and social contributions within the global community.

At present, Yonsei University offers a wide range of comprehensive undergraduate and graduate programs, complemented by state-of-the-art research and medical facilities. With a diverse student body, the university enrolls over 38,000 students across its four campuses. Yonsei University has established an extensive global network and actively collaborates with over 660 partners, reflecting its commitment to global outreach and accessibility. This makes it a significant contributor not only in East Asia but also on a global scale.

Yonsei University is highly regarded for its significant contributions to various academic research areas, encompassing fields such as medicine, biochemistry, human health, engineering, materials science, chemistry, neuroscience, humanities, and social sciences. With 153 research centers and institutes, the university promotes interdisciplinary, policy-relevant research, and nurtures globally-minded leaders in convergence research.

Furthermore, Yonsei University has gained international attention for its initiatives aimed at promoting sustainable development and its active involvement in addressing critical global issues, including climate change, poverty, and inequality. These efforts underscore the university's commitment to making a positive impact on a global scale.
similar_universities: Simon Business School, University of Rochester
J. Mack Robinson College of Business
American University of Ras Al Khaimah
Schulich School of Business , York University

name: Zhejiang University
description:
Zhejiang University (ZJU) stands as one of China's premier institutions of higher education, boasting a rich history dating back to 1897 with the establishment of the Qiushi Academy. Located in the picturesque city of Hangzhou, ZJU is organized into seven faculties and 36 schools. The university is home to an impressive roster of 3,611 full-time faculty members, including 41 members of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the Chinese Academy of Engineering. ZJU has a thriving student body, with 53,673 students, and notably, over 53% of them are pursuing postgraduate studies.

Zhejiang University has earned recognition for its research prowess and academic standing, consistently ranking among the top three institutions in mainland China. It also enjoys a strong global reputation, featuring in the top 100 of both the Times Higher Education World Reputation Rankings and QS World University Rankings. The university's commitment to academic excellence is underscored by the fact that 18 disciplines at ZJU have been selected for China's "Double First-class" Initiative, ranking third in the nation. Additionally, 39 disciplines have received an A grade in the recent national assessment, positioning ZJU as a leader in China.

ZJU prides itself on fostering a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship. Its researchers are actively contributing to various critical areas addressing global challenges, including artificial intelligence, large aircraft assembly technology, clean energy, ocean technology, industrial control technology, and global public health initiatives focusing on infectious disease prevention and treatment. ZJU is particularly renowned for its role in incubating numerous successful business start-ups, with over 100 of its alumni leading listed companies, cementing the university's reputation for excellence and leadership.

Dedicated to driving change both within China and on a global scale, ZJU has implemented transformative initiatives. These include the establishment of a high-level platform for intellectual property exchange and the formation of influential think-tanks such as the China Academy of Western Region Development, the National Research Center for Agricultural and Rural Development, and the Institute for Public Policy, all contributing to ZJU's research efforts in the social sciences.

ZJU has cultivated partnerships with more than 180 institutions across over 30 countries worldwide. These partnerships encompass prestigious institutions like Imperial College London, the University of Sydney, and the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. With a substantial cohort of 6,843 international students and an annual participation of around 8,000 faculty and students in various overseas mobility programs, ZJU actively leverages its extensive network to nurture talent with a global perspective. Furthermore, in collaboration with the Universities of Edinburgh and Illinois, ZJU has established the ZJU-UoE and ZJU-UIUC Institutes on Haining International Campus, further solidifying its commitment to global education and research initiatives.
similar_universities: The Central Academy of Drama, China
Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech)
University of Canterbury | Te Whare Wānanga o Waitaha

name: Academy of Fine Arts Vienna
description:
The Academy of Fine Arts Vienna has a rich history spanning over 300 years, establishing itself as a prominent European institution for nurturing artistic talent. In its role as a university, the Academy of Fine Arts Vienna places a strong emphasis on educational processes rooted in both research and art. This approach involves a fusion of scientific and artistic research, with the resulting insights integrated into the curricula in diverse ways. Additionally, these discoveries are shared with a wider audience through exhibitions, symposia, lectures, and a dedicated publication series.

Presently, the Academy accommodates approximately 1,400 students, providing a wide array of courses that encompass various artistic disciplines. These offerings encompass traditional areas such as painting and sculpture, as well as more contemporary fields like photography, video art, performance, and conceptual art. The curriculum also extends to disciplines beyond the fine arts, including architecture, scenography, and conservation/restoration.

To maintain a high level of theoretical rigor across all departments, the Academy has established the Institutes of Art Theory and Cultural Studies, as well as the Institute of Natural Sciences and Technology in the Arts. These institutes offer seminars and engage in numerous projects, contributing to the development of a strong theoretical foundation for artistic practice. This commitment to theory is closely connected to the training of art teachers, considered pivotal in the dissemination and communication of art to a broader audience.

The academic structure at the Academy of Fine Arts Vienna encompasses diploma studies and/or bachelor/master programs, providing students with a well-rounded educational experience. Furthermore, the institution offers various doctoral programs, including a renowned PhD-in-Practice program that enjoys international recognition. Additionally, the master's program in Critical Studies further enriches the educational landscape, ensuring that students receive a comprehensive and intellectually stimulating artistic education
similar_universities: WU (Vienna University of Economics and Business)

name: Amsterdam School of the Arts
description:
The Amsterdam University of the Arts (AHK) has established an organizational structure that is tailored to accommodate the distinct and unique characteristics of its various faculties. This structure is influenced by the diverse nature of the artistic and cultural disciplines in which the university provides training. Additionally, each faculty has its own distinct background, further contributing to the need for a flexible and adaptable organizational framework.

These faculties primarily serve the present and future students, graduates, guest tutors, and professionals in their respective fields. As such, there exists a strong and interconnected relationship between these groups and the university's teaching organization. This relationship allows the institution to respond swiftly and effectively to emerging developments and changes in the artistic and cultural landscape.

The mission of the Amsterdam University of the Arts is to prepare students for careers in the national and international realms of art, culture, and heritage. The AHK is firmly committed to delivering educational excellence. To achieve this, the university's dedicated and accomplished tutors work alongside exceptionally talented students, helping them shape their artistic identities and foster innovative visions. This process includes providing a solid foundation in skills and traditions while fostering collaboration within the dynamic and trend-setting international cultural community centered in Amsterdam.

name: Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB)
description:
Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB) has a rich history dating back to its founding on March 2, 1959. The present main campus of ITB has its roots in earlier engineering schools in Indonesia, each with its distinct characteristics and missions, which collectively influenced the establishment of ITB.

In 1920, the Technische Hogeschool (TH) was established in Bandung, and for a brief period in the mid-forties, it became known as Kogyo Daigaku. Following the birth of the Republic of Indonesia in 1945, the campus housed the Technical Faculty, including a Fine Arts Department, of Universitas Indonesia, with its headquarters in Jakarta. In the early 1950s, a Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences, also part of Universitas Indonesia, was founded on the campus.

The Indonesian government officially founded Institut Teknologi Bandung in 1959 as an institution of higher learning specializing in science, technology, and fine arts. ITB's mission encompasses education, research, and community service.

A significant milestone in ITB's journey towards autonomy occurred with Government Decree No. 155/2000, which granted ITB the status of a Legal Enterprise (Badan Hukum). This new status granted ITB the autonomy to manage its operations effectively and efficiently. It allowed ITB to have full control over program planning and implementation, quality assurance, and decision-making processes, enabling the institution to navigate competition and external pressures more effectively.

ITB is located in Bandung, a city with a population of approximately one and a half million, nestled in the mountainous region of West Java, at an altitude of 770 meters above sea level. The ITB main campus, situated to the north of the city center, along with its other campuses, spans an expansive area totaling 770,000 square meters.
similar_universities: Schulich School of Business , York University

name: Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT), SUNY
description:
The Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT), a part of the State University of New York (SUNY), is dedicated to providing degree programs that are closely aligned with the fashion industry. FIT's academic offerings encompass a wide range of subjects that have relevance to the world of fashion, including art, business, design, mass communication, and technology.

The majority of FIT's majors are offered through two primary schools: the School of Art and Design and the Jay and Patty Baker School of Business and Technology. These schools collectively offer 27 different majors. Additionally, the School of Graduate Studies provides seven graduate-level majors, and the School of Liberal Arts offers undergraduate degrees in fields such as art history, museum professions, film, and media.

FIT has a vibrant student body, with over 7,500 full-time students and more than 2,000 part-time students. The campus provides various amenities for students, including four dormitories, with three located on campus. There are also several on-campus facilities, such as a Barnes & Noble bookstore, a Starbucks, a food court, a dining hall, and a deli.

One distinctive feature of FIT is its Museum at FIT, which houses extensive collections of clothing, textiles, and accessories. The museum's permanent collection boasts over 50,000 items spanning from the 18th century to the modern era, making it a valuable resource for students and researchers in the field of fashion.
similar_universities: J. Mack Robinson College of Business
Columbia University School of professional Studies
Penn State College of Engineering, School of Engineering Design and Innovation
The Mitchell E. Daniels, Jr. School of Business
Rutgers University School of Environmental and Biological Sciences

name: Kookmin University
description:
Kookmin University, established as the first private university following Korea's independence, owes its creation to Mr. Shin Ik Hee and other key members of the Shanghai interim government of Korea. Embracing the core values of humanism, nationalism, culturalism, and industrialism, which were fervently championed by Mr. Kim Sung Gon, Kookmin University has evolved into a prominent institution within Korea's academic landscape. Today, it boasts an enrollment of 23,000 students.

In an academic world characterized by constant change and societal shifts, Kookmin University is committed to becoming a globally recognized institution. The university's vision encompasses the creation of an academic environment unique to Kookmin University while fearlessly embracing the changes and challenges that lie ahead.

At the heart of Kookmin University's developmental ethos lies the concept that change is the catalyst for progress. The university firmly believes that change presents opportunities, and opportunities are the bedrock of challenges. Thus, Kookmin University actively confronts the transformations inherent in its growth journey by continually renewing itself and embracing challenges, ensuring preparedness for any crises that may arise.

In today's knowledge-based society, universities find themselves engaged in a competition more rigorous than ever before. Kookmin University is determined to excel in this competitive landscape through its dedication to growth, adaptation, and resilience in the face of change.
similar_universities: IU International University of Applied Sciences
National Kaohsiung University of Hospitality and Tourism (NKUHT)

name: Korea University
description:
Korea University, established in 1905, holds the distinction of being the first university in Korea funded and administered solely by Koreans. Its founding was spearheaded by Lee Young-Ik, Treasurer of the Royal Household, who believed that the key to Korea's independence and prosperity lay in the education of its youth. Over the course of a century, Korea University has steadfastly upheld the vision of its founder. Today, the university's mission is to educate and empower students to become responsible citizens, excel in their chosen fields, and contribute to the betterment of their nation and the world.

Korea University boasts a diverse student body of over 33,000 individuals hailing from all corners of Korea and the globe. The university houses eighteen colleges and divisions, along with eighteen graduate schools encompassing a wide range of disciplines, from the Humanities to Engineering and Science. It also hosts specialized centers, such as the East Asiatic Research Center and the Korean Cultural Research Center, as well as esteemed professional schools in Law, Medicine, Engineering, and Business Administration. Complementing its educational mission, Korea University operates the Korea University Hospital, dedicated to providing excellent healthcare services while training future doctors and nurses.

Situated on a spacious and lush campus spanning over 182 acres, Korea University is centrally located in Seoul's An-Am neighborhood, with easy access to subway and metro bus lines. The campus architecture is inspired by the Gothic style of Middle Ages Europe, and it houses well-appointed classrooms, modern laboratories, and computer centers throughout. A recent addition is the Central Plaza, offering dining options, coffee shops, a bookstore, and study areas for student convenience and relaxation.

Korea University boasts a distinguished faculty of over 1,100 members, 95% of whom hold Ph.D. degrees or the highest qualifications in their respective fields. While many faculty members have achieved international acclaim for their research, it is their commitment to teaching that sets them apart and benefits the students. The faculty collectively shares the dedication to providing students with a top-tier education that prepares them to become leaders and innovators in their chosen fields.

As Korea University embarks on its second century, it does so with a commitment to attracting highly capable and deserving students while offering them the finest educational opportunities. The university aspires not only to be one of the premier institutions in Korea and Asia but also to achieve global recognition as one of the world's great universities.
similar_universities: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

name: Lebanese Canadian University Lebanon
description:
The Lebanese Canadian University (LCU) has established itself as a prominent institution in the highly competitive field of higher education. With world-class academic programs, a dedicated and experienced faculty, motivated students, a vibrant student life, cutting-edge facilities, and a campus built to international standards, LCU has earned an enviable reputation.

The official recognition of LCU's achievements and expertise came through presidential decree no 778/2007 and ministerial order no 1035/m/2008, which bestowed upon the university the official status of a University. This recognition not only acknowledged LCU's accomplishments but also opened doors for further academic and infrastructure development.

LCU's commitment to excellence is evident in its academic offerings, which are developed in partnership with prestigious European and North American universities known for their innovation and quality. These partnerships enable LCU to provide Lebanese students with academic programs and degrees of international caliber.

In addition to its Faculty of Business Administration, formerly known as "Ecole Supérieure et Internationale de Gestion (ESIG)," LCU has established two new faculties: the Faculty of Science and Art and the Faculty of Humanities. Furthermore, the university has embarked on construction projects to enhance its infrastructure and facilities.

LCU remains true to its original mission of providing Lebanese students with a high-quality academic education and prestigious degrees while keeping tuition fees at a reasonable level to ensure accessibility for most students. This commitment to both excellence and affordability contributes to LCU's continued success and positive reputation in the education sector.
similar_universities: Westminster Business School | University of Westminster
Gulf University for Science and Technology

name: Malmo University
description:
Malmö University, founded in 1998, is a dynamic and relatively young institution situated in the southern part of Sweden. It has emerged as one of the largest universities in the country, serving approximately 25,000 students and employing around 1,400 staff members. Malmö University has played a significant role in the transformation of Malmö, evolving it from an industrial town into a modern center of education and learning.

Located conveniently in the heart of the city, Malmö University comprises five interdisciplinary schools and faculties. These schools bring together diverse fields of study, fostering collaboration and synergy among different disciplines. This approach enriches the educational experience for students, providing them with a broader perspective as they prepare for their future careers.

The schools and faculties at Malmö University are:

Faculty of Culture and Society
Faculty of Health and Society
Faculty of Odontology
School of Education
School of Technology
By integrating various scientific and academic domains, Malmö University offers a unique learning environment where different disciplines intersect and contribute to a well-rounded education. This approach equips graduates with a broader knowledge base and perspective as they embark on their professional journeys.

Malmö University's commitment to interdisciplinary learning and its role in transforming Malmö into an educational hub make it a notable institution in the region. For more information, you can visit their official website at www.malmouniversity.se.
similar_universities: IÉSEG School of Management, Lille - Paris, France

name: Musashino University
description:
Musashino University, located in Ariake Koto, Tokyo, has a distinctive history and connection to the Hongwanji Jodo Shinshu School of Buddhism. Dr. Junjiro Takakusu, a renowned Buddhist scholar, founded the university, and it continues to maintain a unique association with this school of Buddhism.

Students at Musashino University can expect an educational environment that not only fosters learning but also emphasizes character development and enlightenment. This holistic approach to education aims to nurture students academically and spiritually, contributing to their personal growth and well-being.

Furthermore, Musashino University has achieved recognition in the field of art and design, being featured in the QS World University Rankings by Subject 2018. This recognition underscores the university's commitment to providing quality education and training in these creative disciplines.

Overall, Musashino University offers a distinctive educational experience that combines academic excellence with character development, making it a unique and respected institution in Tokyo, Japan.
similar_universities: The Education University of Hong Kong

name: North Carolina State University
description:
North Carolina State University (NC State) has a rich history dating back to its founding in 1887 with a clear mission: to drive economic, societal, and intellectual progress. Today, NC State stands as a premier research institution renowned for excellence across a diverse range of fields, including science, technology, engineering, mathematics, design, humanities, social sciences, textiles, and veterinary medicine.

Situated on a sprawling 2,137-acre campus in Raleigh, the capital city of North Carolina, NC State is strategically positioned to leverage its resources for the betterment of society. The university's community of over 36,000 high-achieving students is dedicated to addressing real-world challenges, collaborating with industry, government, and nonprofit partners, and making a meaningful impact on the world. Through experiential education that includes research opportunities, internships, co-op programs, and transformative acts of service, NC State prepares its graduates to lead in their chosen fields, recognizing the institution's consistent recognition as one of the best values in higher education.

At the heart of NC State's success are its 9,000 faculty and staff members who are global leaders in their respective fields. They transcend disciplinary boundaries, fostering interdisciplinary collaborations and equipping students with the knowledge and skills needed to confront the complex challenges of the future. NC State's commitment to forging dynamic partnerships with government agencies, industry leaders, nonprofit organizations, and academic institutions further solidifies its role in reshaping the world for the better.

In summary, North Carolina State University is not only a testament to its history but also a beacon of innovation and progress. Its enduring mission and dedicated community continue to drive advancements that benefit society, foster a spirit of leadership, and exemplify the value of higher education.
similar_universities: Rutgers University School of Environmental and Biological Sciences

name: Oslo National Academy of the Arts
description:
The Oslo National Academy of the Arts (KHiO) is Norway's largest institution of higher education dedicated to the arts. It is known for its comprehensive arts education, offering a wide range of programs and disciplines. With over 550 students, 200 employees, and more than 900 guest teachers and short-term contract educators, KHiO is a thriving hub of creative activity.

KHiO's primary mission is to nurture and educate artists and designers who possess the ability to reflect upon and experiment within their chosen fields, ultimately contributing to the diversity and enrichment of society. The academy places a strong emphasis on both critical thinking and creative exploration.

The Oslo National Academy of the Arts is organized into six departments, each focused on specific artistic disciplines:

Design
Art and Craft
The Academy of Fine Art
The Academy of Dance
The Academy of Opera
The Academy of Theatre
These departments collectively offer 24 different study programs, allowing students to pursue their artistic interests and aspirations within a variety of domains. KHiO takes pride in the quality of its faculty, which consists of accomplished professionals and practitioners who are experts in their respective fields.

In 2010, KHiO brought all of its faculties together onto a single campus known as the Seilduken campus. The site of the campus was originally home to the Christiania Sailcloth Factory, founded in 1856, and it has been renovated and customized to accommodate the academy's needs. The historic architecture of the site has influenced the design of KHiO's facilities, which include workshops, studios, a library, galleries, exhibition spaces, a canteen, and classrooms.

The Oslo National Academy of the Arts provides a vibrant and interdisciplinary learning environment where students are encouraged to explore, experiment, and create within their chosen artistic disciplines. It is a dynamic institution dedicated to fostering the next generation of artists and designers.
similar_universities: The Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK)
IE School of Science and Technology

name: Sungkyunkwan University (SKKU)
description:
ungkyunkwan University (SKKU) is a distinguished institution of higher education with a rich heritage spanning over six centuries. Its origins date back to 1398 when it was established as a royal Confucian academy during the early Joseon Dynasty (1392-1910). Throughout its long history, SKKU has consistently exhibited strong academic leadership and commitment to excellence.

In the contemporary era, SKKU has embraced globalization and has risen as a prominent university not only in Asia but also on the global stage. The university actively promotes international collaboration by facilitating faculty and student exchanges and fostering cutting-edge research and educational initiatives in partnership with institutions worldwide.

The name "Sungkyunkwan" embodies a fusion of tradition and innovation. Its literal meaning, "An institution for building a harmonious society of enlightened human beings," remains as relevant today in our technologically advanced society as it was in the past. With a dedicated full-time faculty of over 1,400 members, SKKU prioritizes both quality teaching and research, providing students with a challenging environment conducive to intellectual and personal growth.

As the oldest university in East Asia and a premier educational institution in Korea for centuries, Sungkyunkwan University has produced numerous graduates who have significantly shaped the nation's history and culture. The university's motto, "Su-Gi-Chi-In," which translates to "Benevolence, Righteousness, Propriety, Wisdom," emphasizes the importance of personal improvement and contributions to society. This core ideology has been the guiding principle behind SKKU's mission to nurture influential leaders, thus contributing to the development of Korean society.

SKKU is committed to educating future global leaders who embody these fundamental values, ultimately aiming to advance not only Korean society but also the betterment of humanity as a whole. Sungkyunkwan University continues to integrate its founding philosophy with modern technology, ensuring the cultivation of talented individuals capable of leading society toward a brighter and more prosperous future.

name: The Courtauld Institute of Art
description:
The Courtauld is globally renowned as one of the foremost institutions dedicated to the study of art history and art conservation. Founded in 1932, this prestigious institution, located within London's iconic Somerset House, boasts a relatively small student body, typically under 500 students. Notably, a significant portion of its alumni have gone on to become directors of some of the world's most renowned museums.

The Courtauld primarily offers an undergraduate program in the field of art history. However, its postgraduate offerings are more diverse, allowing students to specialize in specific areas, such as Buddhist art. Students benefit from unparalleled access to a vast library collection, including one of the largest holdings of art history books, exhibition catalogues, and periodicals in the UK. Additionally, the institute houses an impressive gallery with a collection comprising approximately 530 paintings and over 26,000 prints and drawings. Unfortunately, access to the gallery is currently restricted to the public. The Courtauld is also undergoing a significant regeneration project to enhance its facilities and offerings.

name: Universidad Autónoma Metropolitana (UAM)
description:
The Autonomous Metropolitan University (UAM) is a prestigious public institution with a rich history of over 45 years, making it one of Mexico's leading universities. UAM offers a comprehensive range of educational programs, including 82 undergraduate and 111 postgraduate programs, catering to a diverse student body of over 59,705 individuals.

UAM is known for its innovative and flexible academic model, consistently at the forefront of higher education. It maintains strong ties with its social environment, adapting to the evolving needs of society. The university boasts a highly qualified academic staff, with over 3,088 faculty members who prioritize a balanced approach to teaching and research. Notably, 89% are full-time faculty, and 87% hold postgraduate degrees. Furthermore, more than 38% of UAM faculty are registered in the National Researcher's System (Sistema Nacional de Investigadores - SNI), signifying the high quality and relevance of their research contributions.

UAM operates from five strategically located campuses around Mexico City: Azcapotzalco, Cuajimalpa, Iztapalapa, Xochimilco, and Lerma (State of México). Each campus houses three divisions, specializing in various fields of study and research, promoting sustainability degrees and multidisciplinary perspectives.

The university actively engages in institutional research programs and international collaborations, contributing to Mexico's growth and development across various domains, including nanotechnology, biology, sustainable energy, materials science, mathematics, economics, education, and many others.

UAM's fundamental objectives include producing graduates equipped with a robust academic foundation, skills, and a modern outlook to address evolving societal needs. Additionally, the university is committed to solving national and international social challenges through basic and applied research across diverse fields.

UAM is widely recognized for its contributions to society in areas such as science, technology, humanities, and the arts. It fosters a culture of social responsibility among its students, inspiring them to contribute to finding solutions to pressing social issues. The university transforms knowledge into practical applications for the benefit of society and collaborates with national and international institutions and research centers through research, academic exchanges, student mobility programs, joint research initiatives, academic networks, seminars, courses, lectures, and social service projects.
other_campuses: Universidad Autónoma Metropolitana Rectoría General UAM,Mexico

name: Universidad Iberoamericana IBERO
description:
Universidad Iberoamericana (IBERO), located in its Mexico City campus, is renowned as one of Mexico's premier private educational institutions, known both domestically and internationally for the exceptional quality of its academic programs.

IBERO's core mission is to promote, disseminate, and enhance higher education by educating the professionals, educators, researchers, and technicians required by our society.

Currently, IBERO offers a comprehensive array of educational programs, including 36 bachelor's degree programs, 44 graduate degree programs (comprising 28 master's degrees, 11 doctorates, and 5 specializations), with most of them holding certifications from either Mexican or international accreditation bodies. Several programs have been endorsed by Mexico's National Council for Science and Technology (CONACYT). Additionally, IBERO provides over 200 diploma programs and other courses designed to deliver training to corporations, government institutions, and individuals.

With a history spanning over 75 years, Universidad Iberoamericana (IBERO) stands as one of Mexico's earliest private universities and the oldest Jesuit institution of higher learning in the nation.

Built upon a legacy of continuous improvement, IBERO offers rigorous research and academic programs aimed at preparing students for life's challenges. The university's educational approach emphasizes the holistic development of individuals, fostering an appreciation for diverse faiths, cultures, and beliefs.

IBERO operates under the guidance of the Society of Jesus, an organization committed to advancing a more free, compassionate, just, inclusive, productive, and peaceful society. This mission is achieved through the cultivation and dissemination of knowledge and the education of professionals and researchers who possess high levels of both intellectual and human qualities. These individuals are internationally competitive, dedicated to serving others, and driven by authentic human, social, and transcendent values.

name: Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (UPM)
description:
The Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (Technical University of Madrid) may be a relatively young university, established in 1971, but many of its constituent schools boast a rich history dating back to the 18th and 19th centuries. These schools, which existed independently before their integration into the Politécnica, have played a pivotal role in shaping the history of Spanish technology for well over a century. In fact, they were often the sole technical institutions in Spain within their respective fields during certain periods. Numerous prominent Spanish educators and researchers have had connections to the Politécnica de Madrid, whether as students, faculty members, or both.

The university's roots can be traced back to the 18th century when three schools were founded. The School of Architecture, the oldest among them, was established in 1752. Subsequently, the Naval Engineering School and the Mining Engineering School were founded in 1772 and 1777, respectively. The 19th century saw the establishment of the Civil Engineering School in 1802, marking the beginning of the century's educational contributions. Nearly 50 years later, in 1850, the School of Industrial Engineering was founded, expanding its focus to include various fields such as Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical, and Nuclear Engineering. These institutions collectively represent a significant portion of Spain's technological heritage.
similar_universities: IE School of Science and Technology
Deusto Business School - University of Deusto
UCAM Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

name: Universidad del Desarrollo (UDD)
description:
Universidad del Desarrollo (UDD) is currently dedicated to the significant task of promoting scientific activity. It has transformed into a versatile university with a strong emphasis on research. As such, it is essential for us to uphold our core value of public responsibility by actively contributing solutions to the issues that are pertinent to society. We are committed to ensuring that these solutions meet the highest standards of quality, safety, and effectiveness.

UDD is characterized as a small, agile, and youthful university. We consider these attributes to be advantages that empower us to be adaptable and efficient in our organizational processes. To continue progressing, we are not only encouraging our researchers to engage in high-impact research but also to effectively adapt to a dynamic global landscape, fostering collaboration with partners from all around the world.

name: Università Iuav di Venezia
description:
Università Iuav di Venezia has a rich history dating back to 1926 when it was founded as one of the earliest Architecture Schools in Italy. Today, it continues to maintain its distinct identity as a design-focused university, specializing in the education, research, and practice of designing living spaces and environments, which encompass buildings, cities, landscapes, and territories. Additionally, it offers comprehensive programs in designing everyday objects, fashion, and graphics. In recent years, the university has also established itself as a hub for visual arts, theater, performing arts, and multimedia events.

Why choose Iuav?

Leadership in Design and Art: Iuav is renowned as one of the top Design and Art Schools in Europe and globally. It stands out as a unique institution that covers architecture, urban planning, design, visual arts, theater, and fashion comprehensively.

Diverse Educational Offerings: As the only university in Italy offering such a wide range of disciplines, Iuav provides students with a well-rounded education that combines tradition with innovation. Students have the opportunity to engage with distinguished faculty and professionals at the forefront of their fields.

International Outlook: Iuav embraces its international character, offering courses, internships, and opportunities both within Italy and abroad. The university actively promotes student exchanges, fostering a global perspective.

Preparation for Career Success: Iuav equips students with the knowledge, skills, and expertise necessary to excel in the global job market. It maintains a strong reputation for producing graduates who are well-prepared for professional success.

Excellence in Venice: Located in the unparalleled city of Venice, Iuav benefits from its unique surroundings, known for their beauty, culture, and lifestyle. This exceptional setting enhances the university's appeal as a School of Excellence.

In summary, Università Iuav di Venezia combines a rich tradition with a commitment to innovation, offering students a world-class education and an opportunity to thrive in the dynamic fields of design, art, and related disciplines.
similar_universities: Alma Mater Studiorum - University of Bologna

name: University of Tsukuba
description:
The University of Tsukuba, established in October 1973, is a prominent comprehensive university in Japan. Remarkably, it boasts a legacy intertwined with the nation's modernization journey, dating back over 130 years to the Meiji era. Initially founded as the Normal School in 1872, it evolved into the Tokyo Higher Normal School, Japan's first teachers' college. Subsequently, in 1947, the Tokyo University of Education, the institution's predecessor, relocated to the Tsukuba area, approximately 60 km (36 miles) northeast of Tokyo, eventually becoming the University of Tsukuba in 1973.

The University of Tsukuba has consistently led university reform efforts in Japan, especially in breaking down disciplinary boundaries. Its academic and research units were intentionally structured to facilitate interdisciplinary collaboration, setting an example for other Japanese universities. Additionally, Tsukuba introduced Japan's first graduate-level evening courses tailored for professionals, including fields such as law and international business.

Situated in the heart of Tsukuba Science City, the university has closely paralleled the city's development. This science city is renowned worldwide for its concentration of major research institutes, including the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) and the High Energy Accelerator Research Organization (KEK). The name "Tsukuba" has gained international recognition for its numerous research achievements.

The campus itself is distinct, encompassing a vast 258-hectare (636-acre) area, making it the largest single campus in Japan. Surrounded by picturesque natural beauty, both the campus and the city provide a unique environment. Despite this, Tsukuba remains easily accessible from the metropolitan district, thanks to the Tsukuba Express, a train system introduced in 2005 that connects downtown Tsukuba with Akihabara, Tokyo, in just 45 minutes.
similar_universities: The Mitchell E. Daniels, Jr. School of Business

name: Utrecht School of the Arts
description:
HKU University of the Arts Utrecht is a globally engaged institution that actively participates in numerous international projects. It offers a wide array of programs, including preparatory courses, bachelor's and master's programs, and research degrees spanning fine art, design, music, theatre, media, games and interaction, as well as arts management.

The university has cultivated strong partnerships with nearly 200 educational institutions worldwide, fostering the exchange of lecturers, students, and collaborative projects. Notably, nearly 20% of the student body hails from outside the Netherlands. Foreign students can engage with HKU through various avenues, including regular enrollment, participation in exchange programs like Erasmus, bilateral exchange initiatives, or pursuing advanced degrees such as MA, MPhil, or PhD.

A distinctive aspect of the university is its emphasis on practical experience. Students have the opportunity to work on real-world projects for clients in various industries, be it commercial enterprises, non-profit organizations, or cultural initiatives. This hands-on approach enables them to discover their strengths and what they can contribute to the world as designers, educators, producers, or performers. HKU's educational philosophy centers on nurturing creative professionals and entrepreneurs with initiative, equipping them to identify opportunities both domestically and internationally.

name: École Nationale Supérieure des Beaux-Arts, Paris
description:
The École nationale supérieure des beaux-arts is an expansive architectural complex situated in the heart of Saint-Germain-des-Prés, between quai Malaquais and rue Bonaparte, directly across from the Louvre Museum. As a public institution with administrative status, it operates under the purview of the Ministry of Culture and Communication. The primary mission of ENSBA is to provide education to students aspiring to achieve excellence in artistic creation.

With its origins tracing back to the 17th century Royal Academy of Painting and Sculpture established by Louis XIV, ENSBA remains a prominent hub for artistic creation, heritage preservation, and historical research. It continues to play a vital role in the artistic and cultural landscape.

The École operates under the supervision of the French Ministry of Culture and Communication and is dedicated to the education and training of students with a strong commitment to achieving artistic excellence. Its comprehensive five-year curriculum equips students with the foundational skills necessary for the development and sustenance of their individual artistic endeavors. Furthermore, students gain a profound understanding of the contemporary art landscape.

Education and training at ENSBA are centered around artistic practice studios, which are led by distinguished artists. The institution encourages transdisciplinarity, diversity in practice, exploration across various fields, and the freedom to move between different approaches and specialized areas of study. This approach fosters a rich and dynamic learning environment that empowers students to thrive in the world of art.
similar_universities: European School of Political and Social Sciences
ESCE – Ecole Superieure de Commerce Exterieur
IÉSEG School of Management, Lille - Paris, France

name: Academy of Fine Arts
description:
For many years, the Academy has maintained a relatively stable student population, typically around 330 students. The ratio of students to lecturers in specialized ateliers is tailored to the specific needs of nurturing young talents. The institution places significant emphasis on theoretical education, aesthetics, and the imparting of craftsmanship skills through dedicated workshops. These aspects are complemented by a wide range of courses available within its Lifelong Learning Programme.

The Academy of Fine Arts also houses departments dedicated to scientific research and inquiry, along with valuable resources such as a library and a historical archive. Additionally, it boasts its own gallery for showcasing artistic endeavors. The institution actively participates in international exchange programs and has established enduring bilateral agreements with esteemed partners worldwide. As part of this academic structure, the independent Guest Professor Studio further enriches the educational experience.

The Academy of Fine Arts is well-equipped to provide intensive, focused support for talent development. It offers spacious north-facing historical ateliers equipped with overhead lighting and various technological workshops. The institution is committed to delivering personalized instruction and maintains a well-defined teaching framework. This framework permits students to transfer between ateliers and disciplines as they pursue their artistic journeys.
similar_universities: Prague University of Economics and Business

name: Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw
description:
The Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw (Polish: Akademia Sztuk Pięknych w Warszawie) is a public institution dedicated to visual arts and applied arts, situated in the capital of Poland. Its origins can be traced back to the establishment of the Department of Arts within the Warsaw University during the period of the Duchy of Warsaw in 1812. Subsequently, it became an independent institution in 1844 within Congress Poland. In 1904, it was elevated in status and became known as the Warsaw School of Fine Arts. Finally, in 1932, it attained recognition as an Academy.

Initially, the Academy did not possess a dedicated building, and classes were conducted in various locations throughout the city. Following an architectural competition, the design submitted by Alfons Gravier was selected, and construction commenced in 1911. Remarkably, the building was completed by the onset of the First World War.

The Academy comprises several faculties, each specializing in distinct areas of artistic expression and preservation:

Faculty of Painting
Faculty of Sculpture
Faculty of Graphic Arts
Faculty of Conservation and Restoration of Works of Art
Faculty of Interior Design
Faculty of Industrial Design
Faculty of Media Art
This diverse array of faculties underscores the Academy's commitment to nurturing and advancing various forms of artistic and creative endeavors.
similar_universities: University of Canterbury | Te Whare Wānanga o Waitaha
Savannah College of Art and Design

name: American University of Sharjah
description:
Established in 1997, the American University of Sharjah (AUS) is an independent, non-profit, coeducational institution of higher education modeled after the American liberal arts system. Recognized for its academic excellence and diverse cultural atmosphere, AUS combines a comprehensive liberal arts education with professional studies. The university boasts a student body representing over 90 nationalities.

AUS offers a wide range of academic programs, including:

28 undergraduate majors
45 undergraduate minors
16 master's degrees
Three Ph.D. programs
These programs are offered through various colleges and schools within AUS:

College of Architecture, Art and Design
College of Arts and Sciences
College of Engineering
School of Business Administration
AUS is licensed and accredited by the Commission for Academic Accreditation of the United Arab Emirates Ministry of Education. Additionally, it holds accreditation from the Middle States Commission on Higher Education in the USA since June 2004.

Several engineering programs at AUS, including chemical engineering, civil engineering, computer engineering, electrical engineering, industrial engineering, and mechanical engineering, have received accreditation from the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET.

The computer science program at AUS is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET. AUS was the first university in the Gulf region and the second outside the United States to achieve this recognition.

AUS's Bachelor of Architecture program, offered by the College of Architecture, Art and Design, is accredited by the National Architectural Accrediting Board (NAAB) in the United States, making it the first program outside North America to earn this prestigious accreditation.

The School of Business Administration at AUS has been accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) since April 2011.

AUS offers a wide array of undergraduate and graduate programs across its colleges and schools, providing students with diverse educational opportunities.
similar_universities: The Emirates Academy of Hospitality Management (EAHM)
American University of Ras Al Khaimah

name: Bard College
description:
Bard College has evolved significantly over the years, reflecting its rich and diverse history. Originally established in 1860 as St. Stephen's College during a time of national crisis, the institution's founders faced the challenges of the Civil War era. Although there are no written records documenting their stance on the war, a passage from the College's 1943 catalogue resonates with the institution's ethos since its inception: "While the immediate demands in education are for the training of men for the war effort, liberal education in America must be preserved as an important value in the civilization for which the War is being fought. . . . Since education, like life itself, is a continuous process of growth and effort, the student has to be trained to comprehend and foster his own growth and direct his own efforts."

Building upon its 150-year history as a competitive and forward-thinking undergraduate institution, Bard College has expanded its mission to reach students across the nation and around the world while addressing a broader range of student needs. Currently, approximately 2,000 undergraduates are enrolled in Bard's Annandale campus, and over 200 graduate students participate in Bard programs. Additionally, nearly 1,000 students are enrolled in Bard's early colleges. When considering the total enrollment of Bard College and its global affiliates, the institution serves approximately 5,000 students.

name: Beijing Institute of Fashion Technology
description:
The School of Fashion, established in 1987, enrolls undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral students from across the country. Guided by the philosophy of "Creativity Merging with Technology, Design Inheriting Culture," the school is dedicated to refining its elite training methods and promoting quality education at the Beijing Institute of Fashion Technology (BIFT).

The School of Fashion offers five majors and thirteen undergraduate directions, including:

Fashion Design & Accessories: Offering six directions, including Womenswear, Menswear, Knitswear, Sportswear, Inheritance & Innovation, and Costumes.
Fashion Design & Engineering: With two directions, focusing on Fashion Product Development and Fashion Buying & Merchandising.
Fashion Performance: Comprising three directions, namely Fashion Performance, Fashion Performance Choreographer, and Advertising Communication.
Fashion Communication: Focusing on Fashion Culture and Communication.
Art & Technology: Specializing in Fiber & Fashion.
Notably, Fashion Design & Accessories and Fashion Design & Engineering are national characteristic specialties, while Fashion Performance is a characteristic specialty of Beijing. The school builds on the foundation of three first-grade disciplines: Design Theory, Textile Science & Engineering, and Art Theory, offering various graduate majors and research directions. These include Fashion Art & Design, Fashion Design & Engineering, Textile Materials & Textile Design, Costume History and Style, and Chinese & Foreign Fashion Culture.

Furthermore, the school features a Ph.D. program named "Rescue, Inheritance, and Innovation in Chinese Traditional Costume Culture" to address the country's specific requirements. The school's mission revolves around nurturing talent within the Fashion & Textile Industry and Cultural & Creative Industry sectors, emphasizing qualities such as adaptability, creativity, promptness, and integrity.

Currently, the School of Fashion has an enrollment of approximately 1,530 undergraduate students, 180 graduate students, and 5 postgraduate students. Over the years, around 5,000 students have graduated from the school, earning approximately 300 awards, including 125 gold, silver, and bronze awards in various domestic and international competitions over the past three years. These competitions include the Arts of Fashion Competition, Hanbo Award International Young Designers Competition, Miss World Final Competition, CCTV Model Competition, and more.

name: Beijing Institute of Technology
description:
Beijing Institute of Technology (BIT) is a public university that has traditionally focused on science and technology but is expanding its scope to include other areas such as management and humanities. The institute places a strong emphasis on ethical scholarship, the pursuit of truth, and making significant academic contributions to humanity.

BIT's history dates back to its founding in 1940 in Yan’an, Shaanxi Province. In 1949, it was relocated to Beijing. The following year, the main campus and the Departments of Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry of the Institut Franco-Chinois were merged with BIT.

BIT has always aligned its strategies with the country's strategic needs and global developments in science, technology, and education, while also considering its own strengths and mission. These strategic priorities include:

Consolidating strengths in mechanical and vehicle engineering and automation.
Leveraging advantages and distinctive programs in IT-related disciplines.
Developing new strengths in aerospace engineering.
BIT aims to excel in both science and engineering disciplines while simultaneously expanding its offerings in management and humanities.

Currently, BIT boasts more than 3,500 faculty members and an enrollment of 25,000 full-time students. Among these students, over 14,000 are pursuing undergraduate degrees, nearly 8,000 are engaged in graduate programs, and more than 3,000 are doctoral students.

name: Beirut Arab University
description:
Beirut Arab University, located in the Lebanese capital city of Beirut, is a prominent institution with over 16,000 students. It ranks among the top universities in the Arab region. The university operates from multiple campuses, including an urban campus in Beirut, a suburban campus in Debbieh, and another campus in Tripoli.

The university offers a diverse range of programs across ten different faculties, covering fields such as engineering, medicine, science, and business administration. Most of these programs are conducted in English, with the exception of certain degrees offered by the Faculties of Arts and Law. For specific information about English language admissions requirements, prospective students can refer to the university's official website.

Haskayne School of Business, University of Calgary

name: Donghua University
description:
Donghua University (DHU), originally known as China Textile University, was established in 1951. The university has gained recognition, both nationally and internationally, for its distinct disciplines, including Fashion Design, Textile Engineering, International Trade, Material Science, and Information Technology.

DHU is a comprehensive institution offering a wide array of undergraduate and graduate degree programs spanning various fields of study, including engineering, economics, management, literature and art, law, science, and education. The university comprises 13 colleges and schools, providing 54 undergraduate programs, 59 master's degree programs, 30 doctoral degree programs, and 5 postdoctoral research programs. Notably, it is home to 6 state key disciplines and 7 Shanghai municipal key disciplines. Research conducted at DHU has yielded practical applications in fields such as aeronautics, military science, new materials, architecture, and environmental protection. The university ranks among the top 12 Chinese institutions in terms of the number of valid patents.

DHU boasts a diverse academic community, with more than 2,800 faculty and staff members and over 30,000 enrolled students. The university consistently achieves a 100% employment rate for postgraduates and a rate exceeding 95% for undergraduates. Over the years, DHU has established collaborations with more than 100 renowned international universities, research institutions, and enterprises. Additionally, the university has successfully hosted international conferences and forums, particularly in fields related to textiles, fashion, and materials.

Les Roches Global Hospitality Management Education

name: Estonian Academy of Arts
description:
The Estonian Academy of Arts (EKA), known as Eesti Kunstiakadeemia, was founded in 1914 and holds the distinction of being Estonia's oldest and only public university dedicated to visual culture. EKA offers a diverse range of academic programs, with over 30 curricula available across its four faculties: Architecture, Design, Art Culture, and Fine Arts.

One of EKA's notable features is its international focus, as the academy offers eight Master's programs and two doctoral programs in English, along with a Bachelor's program taught in Russian. These programs attract a diverse student body of around 1,200 individuals from various parts of the world. EKA's educational approach emphasizes the cultivation of analytical skills, critical thinking, and a commitment to environmental and social responsibility among its students. The teaching staff comprises experts in their respective fields, including internationally recognized artists, architects, designers, and scholars, who provide personalized instruction and mentorship within an interdisciplinary and collaborative learning environment. Approximately 10% of the student body represents foreign countries.

In recognition of its academic excellence, EKA was included in the QS World University Rankings' list of the Top 200 Architecture and Design Universities in 2017.

EKA's modern campus, designed by its alumni, was inaugurated in 2018 and has received numerous awards for its architecture and interior design. Situated between the historic UNESCO World Heritage city of Tallinn and the lively Kalamaja district, the academy serves as a hub of artistic culture.

The academy maintains partnerships with leading universities specializing in architecture, art, and design worldwide. It is an active member of key educational and professional networks within its fields, providing students and staff with extensive opportunities to broaden their artistic perspectives. EKA also plays a pivotal role in shaping Estonia's design, urban planning, art, and education strategies, contributing to the betterment of local society and the living environment. Through its alumni and its own initiatives, the Estonian Academy of Arts represents Estonia on the global stage. The academy welcomes individuals who are socially conscious, motivated, and creatively inclined to join its vibrant academic community.

name: Falmouth University
description:
Falmouth is an exceptional place for students to pursue their education. It's a community that values collaboration, innovation, and the spirit of change-makers.

With a forward-looking approach, we're actively exploring the possibilities offered by new technologies and entrepreneurship. We're dedicated to pushing the boundaries and harnessing the transformative power of creativity.

Our educational philosophy is hands-on from day one. Students begin working on real-world projects as soon as they step onto campus. This approach ensures that they acquire the skills and knowledge needed to excel in the creative economy upon graduation.

All our programs are designed in close collaboration with industry professionals. Students engage in live projects, utilize cutting-edge facilities, and learn from faculty members who are experts in their respective fields.

But university life isn't just about academics; it's also a time for personal growth, forming lifelong friendships, and discovering new passions. Our welcoming and inclusive community serves as the cornerstone of student life. Like-minded individuals can connect with their peers and thrive within this supportive environment.

Located in one of the most stunning parts of the country, with a vibrant social scene that rivals larger cities, Falmouth offers an incredible and inspiring place to live and study.

name: Fudan University
description:
Fudan University is one of the most sought-after choices for aspiring Chinese undergraduates. Located in the vibrant heart of Shanghai in the Wujiaochang area, Fudan is a comprehensive research-oriented university with a stellar reputation in the fields of arts, sciences, and medicine, both nationally and internationally.

Founded in 1905 as Fudan Public School, it holds the distinction of being the first higher education institution established by a Chinese individual. The name "Fudan" is derived from two Chinese characters: "fù," meaning "return," and "dàn," meaning "dawn." These characters were borrowed from the Confucius classic, A Commentary on The Classic of History, which mentions, "Brilliant are the sunshine and moonlight, again the morning radiance returns at dawn." In 2000, Fudan University underwent a merger with Shanghai Medical University, forming the modern Fudan University.

The university boasts a sprawling campus area of approximately 2,500,000 square meters, divided into four campuses: Handan (the main campus in Wujiaochang area), Fenglin, Jiangwan, and Zhangjiang. Fudan is home to 35 schools and departments offering 11 broad subject areas, 5 state-level key laboratories, 29 provincial and ministerial-level laboratories, 17 affiliated hospitals, and libraries housing more than 5.5 million books and extensive digital resources.

Fudan University attracts around 4,000 international students from diverse corners of the globe. Students can engage in a wide range of extracurricular activities, including cultural and hobby sessions organized by student societies (including 17 primarily constituted by international students) and public lectures featuring top industrial leaders and scholars from both home and abroad, including Nobel laureates.

Fudan's undergraduate curriculum typically involves the first two years dedicated to general education, followed by two or three years of specialized study in their chosen fields. The university strongly supports student entrepreneurship, collaborating with its global alumni networks.

The university's motto, "scientia et studium, quaestio et cogitatio," embodies its commitment to being rich in knowledge and tenacious in purpose, encouraging earnest inquiry and reflective self-practice. Fudan University is highly regarded for its longstanding tradition of academic independence and free inquiry.

Fudan University is a proud member of the esteemed C9 League, often referred to as China's Ivy League, and is recognized as a Class A Double First Class University as part of a national initiative to establish world-class institutions and disciplines by 2050.
other_campuses: 220 Handan Road, Yang Pu, Shanghai, CN,China (Mainland)

name: Hanyang University
description:
Hanyang University has a rich history dating back to its establishment in 1939 with a strong focus on technology education and a commitment to the advancement of the country. It was the first private university to develop its engineering department in 1948 and subsequently expanded into various fields in 1959. In 1979, Hanyang University established its second campus in Ansan, Gyeonggi-do, located within one of the largest industrial complexes in South Korea. Currently, the university operates two campuses, serving both undergraduate and graduate students. Additionally, Hanyang University operates a large-scale hospital with approximately 1,400 beds, underscoring its significant presence in the country.

Over its 72-year history, Hanyang University has consistently strived to provide practical education aimed at nurturing talented individuals who can contribute to society. During the 1970s and 1980s, the university gained recognition for producing outstanding graduates who played pivotal roles in South Korea's industrial and modernization efforts. While Hanyang University initially established itself in the field of engineering, it later expanded its educational offerings to include medical, humanities, social sciences, performing arts, and more.

Hanyang University places a strong emphasis on fostering global leaders, a commitment that continues to shape its educational mission. The university is recognized as one of the most promising institutions that can drive development and make a difference in South Korea.

Hanyang University's foundational spirit is encapsulated in the motto "Love in Truth and Deed." The university aims to educate students not only in academic knowledge but also in the values of hard work, honesty, politeness, and community service. It emphasizes the importance of contributing to the local community and the country to cultivate a love for humanity. The philosophy underlying the university's establishment is "Practical Method of Study," which has been passed down in its educational tradition. The university's ability to quickly respond to the evolving needs of society through education and research has earned it a reputation as a leading institution that has significantly contributed to South Korea's modernization and industrialization.

Hanyang University's Erica campus, situated near the industrial complex, has capitalized on its strategic location by establishing the largest Center for Business Incubation and a Technopark. The university is also actively working to develop the largest Erica cluster in the country, aiming to attract corporations and government research centers to its campus.

name: Hunan University
description:
Hunan University is located in the culturally rich and historic city of Changsha, in Hunan Province, China. Situated at the base of the picturesque Yuelu Mountain and along the banks of the Xiangjiang River, it holds the distinction of being an "Ancient Millenarian Academy, Famous Centennial University." Designated as a key and comprehensive university under the Ministry of Education, Hunan University is part of the prestigious "Project 211" and "Project 985" initiatives, signifying its status as a priority institution for investment and development.

The leadership of Hunan University is overseen by Professor Liu Keli, who serves as the Party Secretary of the CPC Hunan University Committee, and Professor Zhao Yueyu, the esteemed President of the university.

The institution comprises a Graduate School and 23 colleges and departments, offering a wide range of professional disciplines spanning 11 subject categories. These categories include philosophy, economics, law, education, literature, history, science, engineering, management, medicine, and arts. Within these disciplines, Hunan University is authorized to confer Ph.D. degrees in 25 first-order disciplines, Master's degrees in 41 first-order disciplines, and a total of 20 academic degree authorizations. Additionally, it boasts 2 key first-order disciplines and 14 key second-order disciplines that have received national recognition. The university also hosts 21 post-doctoral programs, further emphasizing its commitment to academic excellence and research.

Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech)
University of Miami Patti and Allan Herbert Business School (Miami Herbert)

name: Indian Institute of Science
description:
The Indian Institute of Science (IISc) has a rich history dating back to its founding in 1909 through the collaborative efforts of Jamsetji Nusserwanji Tata, the Government of India, and the Maharaja of Mysore. The idea of establishing a science-focused university for the benefit of India was initially conceived by Jamsetji Tata in 1886, and he further supported this vision by creating an endowment in 1898.

Subsequently, the Government of India, in consultation with scientists from both United Kingdom and India, took up the initiative. The decision was made to establish the institute in Bangalore, and the Maharaja of Mysore, Shri Krishnaraja Wodeyar IV, generously donated 372 acres of land for this purpose. The formal establishment of the Institute occurred in 1909, marked by the laying of the foundation stone in 1911. The very first cohort of students commenced their studies in the same year.

Over the course of its 105-year journey, IISc has evolved into the foremost institution for advanced scientific and technological research and education in India. From its humble beginnings with only 2 departments and 21 students in 1911, IISc has grown to encompass more than 40 departments, units, and centers. Today, it boasts an impressive community of 4,000 students and is supported by around 500 dedicated academic and scientific staff, complemented by a team of 600 administrative personnel.

name: Indonesia Institute of the Arts Yogyakarta
description: The Indonesian Institute of the Arts Yogyakarta is one of the four state universities situated in Yogyakarta. It specializes in offering a wide range of courses in visual, performing, and media arts, encompassing both traditional Indonesian and contemporary international styles. The university provides a variety of academic programs at both the undergraduate and postgraduate levels, organized within its two faculties: the Faculty of Fine Arts and the Faculty of Media Recording Art.
