Syracuse University - School of Information Studies

name: Kyoto University
description:
Kyoto University, founded in 1897, is a renowned research-oriented institution in Asia known for producing 13 Nobel Prize laureates. Its motto, "freedom of academic spirit," underscores its commitment to instilling this value in its 22,000 undergraduate and graduate students. Kyoto University consistently ranks among the top institutions globally, typically placing within the top two in Japan, the top 10 in Asia, and the top 50 worldwide, solidifying its prominent position in the academic world.

The Yoshida campus, located at the heart of the university since its inception, is notable for its captivating architecture, featuring diverse styles ranging from historic brick buildings like the iconic Clock Tower Centennial Hall to modern laboratory facilities. Additional campuses, including Uji and Katsura, offer state-of-the-art laboratories, research institutes, and testing facilities, reflecting Kyoto University's commitment to mixing traditional and cutting-edge approaches to education and research. This diversity ensures that there is no single, typical student experience at Kyoto, but all students share a sense of belonging to a forward-thinking academic community that addresses global challenges and embraces new technologies.

Kyoto, the birthplace of manga and Japan's capital for over 1,000 years, offers a rich cultural experience. The city is adorned with cultural treasures reflecting its extensive history, making it a captivating destination for those interested in Japanese culture. Kyoto boasts a high proportion of university students, with one in every 10 residents pursuing higher education, making it the city with the highest student population in Japan. Surrounded by picturesque mountains and serene temple gardens, Kyoto is a haven for nature lovers. It also serves as a hub for conservation efforts.

Compared to cities like Osaka or Tokyo, the cost of living in Kyoto is relatively affordable. The city's compact center allows students to navigate safely by bicycle, contributing to a well-rounded and enriching student life.

name: Kyushu University
description:
Kyushu University, established in 1911, stands as a prominent research-oriented institution of higher education in Fukuoka, Japan. Fukuoka has a rich history of serving as Japan's gateway to Asia, facilitating profound cultural and economic interactions due to its geographical proximity to continental Asia. In 2011, the university celebrated its centennial anniversary and is now boldly moving into its second century of academic excellence.

The university boasts an enrollment of nearly 20,000 students and is organized into 12 undergraduate schools, 18 graduate schools, 17 faculties, 5 research institutes, and a hospital. Additionally, it houses over 50 affiliated research centers. In keeping with its commitment to internationalization, Kyushu University has attracted more than 2,200 international students from approximately 100 countries and regions.

The institution's dedication to cutting-edge research and innovation is exemplified by the modern Ito Campus. This campus is specifically designed to foster the development of next-generation technologies while prioritizing environmental preservation. The research center on the campus embodies a deep respect for the conservation of green spaces, groundwater, landscapes, and historical sites, showcasing the university's commitment to harmoniously coexist with its natural surroundings.
similar_universities: Saveetha Institute of Medical And Technical Sciences (SIMATS)
Solvay Brussels School of Economics and Management (ULB)

name: LASALLE College of the Arts
description:
LASALLE College of the Arts is the premier institution in Asia for contemporary arts and design education and practice. Offering a diverse range of 30 diploma, undergraduate, and postgraduate programs, LASALLE covers fields such as fine arts, design communication, interior design, product design, film, animation, fashion, dance, music, theatre, arts management, arts pedagogy and practice, art therapy, Asian art histories, and creative writing.

The college fosters an interdisciplinary learning environment that nurtures and inspires the next generation of forward-thinking, globally engaged artists, designers, and leaders in creative industries. LASALLE's faculty is led by a distinguished community of award-winning artists, designers, educators, and researchers, and their practice-led research initiatives establish LASALLE as an international center of excellence.

Founded in 1984 by the late De La Salle Brother Joseph McNally, a visionary artist and educator, LASALLE operates as a non-profit private educational institution dedicated to advancing the arts and design education in the region.

name: Lebanese University
description:
The Lebanese University, founded in 1951, holds a unique position as the sole institution in Lebanon offering public higher education across a wide range of majors and academic levels. The university is committed to conducting ongoing scientific research and providing qualification courses to fulfill its national, human, and developmental responsibilities across various sectors.

In recent years, the Lebanese University has embraced an open policy of collaboration with both public and private institutions in Lebanon. This collaboration extends to areas such as research, academics, culture, and development, as well as providing internship opportunities for its students. Numerous agreements and partnerships have been established with private universities, hospitals, organizations, municipalities, research centers, and laboratories to promote cooperation and knowledge exchange.

The Lebanese University has also established public medical centers that offer services to the community, particularly in the fields of dentistry and public health. On an international level, the university has forged cooperation agreements and academic exchange programs with over 250 international universities and institutions. These initiatives aim to enhance educational programs, facilitate the exchange of knowledge and research, and promote collaboration with regional and global educational organizations, including projects like Erasmus and Quality Assurance Project.

Solvay Brussels School of Economics and Management (ULB)

name: National Taiwan University of Science and Technology (Taiwan Tech)
description:
National Taiwan University of Science and Technology (NTUST), known as Taiwan Tech, is a prestigious technological institution established in 1974. Situated in Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, it has emerged as a leading university dedicated to applied research and the development of globally competitive professionals in high-tech industries and management.

Taiwan Tech is renowned for its strong connections with industry, its active promotion of entrepreneurship, and its focus on technology licensing. The university's academic structure is organized into seven colleges, each housing various departments and graduate institutions. These colleges encompass a wide range of fields, including Engineering, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Management, Design, Liberal Arts and Social Sciences, Applied Sciences, and the newest addition, the College of Industry-Academia Innovation.

An important feature of Taiwan Tech is its commitment to social and environmental sustainability in both education and research. The university has gained recognition for its contributions to University Social Responsibility (USR) initiatives, underscoring its dedication to addressing global challenges through education and research. Environmental, social, and governance (ESG) topics are prominently featured in the university's curriculum and research activities, with several dedicated research centers focused on exploring these areas.

Taiwan Tech's educational philosophy revolves around the cultivation of "π-type talents." This unique approach combines a strong foundation in professional disciplines with a significant emphasis on liberal studies and social responsibility. These two pillars are symbolically connected by a horizontal bar representing internationalization, reflecting Taiwan Tech's commitment to preparing graduates for success in the global arena. By fostering robust professional skills, instilling a sense of social responsibility, and promoting an international perspective, the university ensures that its students are well-equipped to thrive in an interconnected world.
similar_universities: National Kaohsiung University of Hospitality and Tourism (NKUHT)

name: Norwegian University of Science And Technology
description:
The Norwegian University of Science and Technology, NTNU, is dedicated to technological education and research in Norway, with a strong foundation in the natural sciences. This tradition is complemented by a broad expertise in traditional university disciplines such as the humanities, medicine, and the social sciences. Additionally, NTNU offers a comprehensive range of education programs in art subjects, including music, the visual arts, and architecture, making it a well-rounded institution among Norwegian universities.

NTNU's academic staff actively collaborates on projects with researchers from around the world. The university has strong partnerships with national and international businesses and industries, as well as Norwegian government authorities. Every year, our research staff is involved in approximately 2000 R&D projects, and we host between 20-30 major scientific conferences.

To bridge the gap between academia and industry, NTNU works closely with two research foundations: the SINTEF Group and Allforsk. We also have formal cooperation agreements with leading Norwegian industrial companies. Furthermore, we have established contracts for R&D and educational programs with various international companies, including prominent names like ABB, Alcatel, BP Amoco, Deminex, ElfTotalFina, Shell, and Verbundnetz Gas. This collaborative approach ensures that our research and educational efforts have a meaningful impact on society and industry, both nationally and internationally.
similar_universities: Penn State University: Smeal College of Business

name: Oslo School of Architecture
description: The Oslo School of Architecture and Design (AHO) is known for its exceptional research-based education, recognized on the international stage. Founded in 1945, it has established a strong foundation of national support and achieved high rankings globally. AHO offers three master's degrees in Architecture, Landscape Architecture, and Design, in addition to a PhD program. The school currently has around 650 students.
similar_universities: University of Canterbury | Te Whare Wānanga o Waitaha

name: Pontificia Universidad Javeriana
description:
PUJ, or Pontifical Javeriana University, is a prestigious private university in Colombia with a rich history dating back to its founding in 1623. Directed by the Society of Jesus, it is one of the oldest and most traditional universities in the country. PUJ has its main facilities in Bogotá and also has a sectional division in Cali. It is part of a network of 31 universities entrusted to the Society of Jesus in Latin America and one of 114 Jesuit universities worldwide.

This university holds the distinction of being the first higher education institution in Colombia to receive institutional accreditation, a recognition it earned through Resolution No. 1320 issued on June 12th, 2003, by the Colombian Ministry of Education. In Bogotá, PUJ comprises 18 colleges housing 62 departments and offering a wide range of academic programs across various fields of knowledge. These programs include 38 undergraduate programs, 73 specialized professional study programs, 39 medical and surgical specializations, 33 master's degrees, and 8 Ph.D. programs.

PUJ's Bogotá campus is home to 18,962 undergraduate students and 4,307 graduate students. The university boasts a faculty of 1,364 professors and 2,702 chair professors, supported by 1,506 administrative employees. The campus encompasses 45 buildings spread over 44.5 acres, strategically located for easy accessibility within the city. PUJ is known for its rigorous selection process, admitting students with exceptional academic qualifications. Its graduates are recognized for their high professional standards, teamwork skills, and commitment to values-based leadership.

name: Shih Chien University
description:
Shih Chien University, formerly known as Shih Chien College of Home Economics, has a rich history dating back to its establishment in 1958 by Mr. Tung-Min Shieh. The university was founded with the core principle of "practice," a concept deeply rooted in the teachings of Wang Yangming, a prominent Chinese philosopher, who believed that knowledge is the starting point of practice, and doing is the culmination of knowing (1498).

Throughout its journey, Shih Chien University has remained committed to this motto, constantly implementing and expanding its educational vision. It initially started as a junior college and gradually progressed to become an institution granting bachelor's degrees. In 1991, it was renamed Shih Chien College of Design and Management to reflect its evolving focus.

Finally, in 1997, the university achieved university status, marking a significant milestone in its history. Today, Shih Chien University consists of three colleges: the College of Human Ecology, the College of Design, and the College of Management. The university has two campuses, one in Taipei and another in Kaohsiung, and is home to approximately 15,000 students, as well as a dedicated faculty and staff of around 700 individuals.
similar_universities: National Kaohsiung University of Hospitality and Tourism (NKUHT)

name: Singapore University of Technology and Design
description:
Creating a new university from the ground up is an incredibly exciting endeavor, especially when it's in a country like Singapore that places such a strong emphasis on education and research. Serving as the founding President of the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) is a great honor, and I'd like to share my vision and aspirations for this institution.

SUTD was established in collaboration with MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) with a clear mission: to advance knowledge and cultivate technically grounded leaders and innovators who can address the pressing needs of society. Our approach is centered around the concept of Design, and we aim to achieve this through a comprehensive, multidisciplinary curriculum and research program.

During my tenure as an Institute Professor and former Dean of Engineering at MIT, I've had the privilege of working with some of the world's most talented and creative individuals. MIT is an institution that thrives on enthusiasm and a profound desire to make a meaningful impact on the world. We do this through several key principles:

First-Class Scholarship: We are committed to rigorous scholarship and research, pushing the boundaries of knowledge, and exploring groundbreaking ideas.

Educating Talented Students: We prioritize the education of the brightest and most capable students, preparing them to excel in their fields and make significant contributions to society.

Fostering Innovation: Innovation is at the core of our culture. We encourage and support an environment that promotes innovation, leadership, and entrepreneurship.

SUTD's journey is just beginning, and it's our goal to create a university that embodies these principles and serves as a beacon of excellence in education and research. We aim to instill in our students a deep sense of purpose, technical proficiency, and the creative capacity to address complex challenges. Together, we will shape the future and make a positive impact on our world through the power of education and innovation.

The University of Texas at Arlington
Haskayne School of Business, University of Calgary

name: Sorbonne University
description:
Sorbonne University, a new French institution, proudly stands on the strong foundations of centuries of academic tradition and excellence in research and education. Born from the merger of two leading Paris universities, Paris-Sorbonne and Pierre & Marie Curie Universities, it now carries forward the renowned Sorbonne name.

Sorbonne University is a globally recognized research powerhouse, encompassing a wide spectrum of disciplines, including arts, humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, engineering, and medicine. Our approach to education and research is meticulously crafted to meet the intellectual and scientific challenges of the 21st century.

With a student body of 53,400 individuals, Sorbonne University is dedicated to providing the best educational opportunities for each student's personal and professional journey. Our programs range from monodisciplinary to interdisciplinary, offering a rich array of options to help students succeed. We have a strong international presence, with 10,200 international students and 4,400 engaged in doctoral programs. Through our three primary faculties, we offer diverse and innovative pathways across various fields of study.

Sorbonne University's research community comprises over 3,400 professor-researchers working diligently in our laboratories and collaborating with major French research organizations. Our institution is home to remarkable transdisciplinary institutes and proudly serves as the headquarters for the European Marine Biological Research Centre.

As an institution with a global perspective, Sorbonne University is deeply committed to an ambitious international agenda in education and research, making a substantial and positive impact on society. We have forged strategic partnerships that leverage our technical and professional expertise for the benefit of our global community.

Sorbonne University, with its rich history and commitment to excellence, looks ahead to a future of continued academic distinction and social impact.
similar_universities: European School of Political and Social Sciences

name: Strate Ecole de Design
description:
Strate School of Design, with its motto "Making the world Simple, Fair, Beautiful," has evolved from its origins as an Industrial Design school into a forward-looking institution focused on training Post-Industrial Designers. Our mission goes beyond the aesthetics of objects; it's about enhancing the quality of life itself. We aim to contribute to people's lives across various contexts, from personal to professional, in a world marked by increasing complexity, technology, and human interaction.

At Strate, we offer education in Product, Space, Identity, Mobility, Interaction, and Immersive Design. Our integrated European Master's degree program spans five years (300 ECTS) and is accredited by the French State. We blend a strong intellectual foundation with a highly professional approach to design education. We also offer two-year MDes Programs in Transportation Design and Smart Cities, which are conducted in English.

Interdisciplinarity is a core principle of our pedagogy. Strate collaborates with prestigious institutions such as SciencesPo Paris and Grenoble Ecole de Management to provide double-degree programs. We prepare our students to work seamlessly with engineers and managers from renowned schools like ESSEC, Centrale Supelec, Telecom ParisTech, ENS Paris-Saclay, Ecole Polytechnique, and Université Paris Dauphine through industry-sponsored projects lasting one semester.

Industry engagement is a fundamental aspect of our education. Our faculty comprises working professionals, and students gain 12 to 18 months of internship experience during their studies. We develop over 30 industry-sponsored projects annually.

To foster a global perspective, all our students spend an international semester abroad, engaging in exchange programs with more than 50 partner schools worldwide. We have partners in North America, Central and South America, Europe, Asia, and Africa, enabling students to gain a diverse cultural and educational experience.

In addition to our primary Design program, Strate offers a one-year Postgrad program in Innovation and Design, a three-year bachelor's program in digital 3D Modeling, and a part-time, 14-month MBA.

Strate has expanded its presence to four campuses: Paris, France (Main Campus); Lyon, France; Singapore, offering a Master in Indesign for Smart Cities (2 years); and India (Bangalore), providing a five-year Master in Design. We are committed to shaping the future of design education and empowering the next generation of designers to make a positive impact on the world.
similar_universities: European School of Political and Social Sciences

name: Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin)
description:
Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin) is a globally renowned institution located in the vibrant city of Berlin, at the heart of Europe. With nearly 34,500 students, a diverse range of academic programs exceeding 100, and a network of 40 institutes, TU Berlin stands as one of Germany's largest technical universities. The university's campuses are strategically situated across Berlin, and it also operates a satellite campus in El Gouna, Egypt.

TU Berlin is a proud member of TU9, an alliance comprising nine of Germany's most prominent technical universities. This membership facilitates student exchanges between various engineering schools and enhances collaborative opportunities.

The university's academic mission is shaped by four distinct objectives:

Building a Distinctive Profile: TU Berlin seeks to establish a unique and recognizable identity among universities.

Exceptional Research and Teaching: The institution is committed to achieving excellence in both research and teaching, fostering innovation and academic rigor.

Graduate Excellence: TU Berlin aims to provide its graduates with outstanding qualifications, preparing them for successful careers in their chosen fields.

Modern University Administration: The university places importance on adopting contemporary approaches to university administration.

Furthermore, TU Berlin actively engages in regional, national, and international collaborations with partners from the realms of science and industry. This extensive network contributes significantly to its research, teaching, and innovation efforts.

With its dedication to excellence, diverse academic offerings, and strategic partnerships, TU Berlin is at the forefront of technological and scientific advancements, making significant contributions to the academic and industrial landscapes.
